dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have entered the home of RICHARD AND ERICA COOPER. The place LOOKS very Norman Rockwell. PICTURES are on the man and ESSENCE MAGAZINES on the coffee table. RICHARD, 38, i an investment banker. He is married to ERICA, 36, a high school English teacher. She’s six months pregnant. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear their DAUGHTER, KELLY, crying in one of the rooms Richard comes out of the master bedroom and stands in the doorway of Kelly’s room. He is tying his tie in a hurry. “Good Morning America” is on the T.V.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Shh... shh... Daddy loves you. Mommy will be right there. She stops crying. He goes back into his room. The instant he leaves the doorway, the crying starts again. He runs o again, sticks his head back in her room, now pulling on h shoes.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Come on now, baby. Mama’s coming. Shhh. Daddy loves you. She stops. He repeats this a few times. Each time he * leaves, she cries instantly and each time he reappears he closer to being ready for work. Finally, fully clothed, h gets the baby out of the room and walks to the bathroom * holding her.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Who’s my baby? Kelly’s my baby. You love your daddy? He knocks on the bathroom door. We can HEAR the shower running.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Erica... Erica. *

dialogues.speaker: ERICA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Yeah, come in. He opens the bathroom door and we see Erica’s beautiful n back as she wraps a towel around herself and starts to dr off.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 3.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Here, can you take her? I gotta get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I got her. Erica takes the baby. Richard kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: You better stop. You’re gonna get * wet.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s okay, I have my raincoat on. They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Call me if you’re going to be late.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks away from her, he looks back. We are seeing a beauty shot of Erica smiling holding the baby. The perfec wife. The CAMERA PUSHES INTO HER VERY SLOWLY.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Hi, I’m Richard Cooper. I’ve been married for seven years and I’m bored out of my fucking mind. 8 INT. RICHARD AND ERICA’S HOUSE - DAY Erica is now playing with their daughter in her playroom. Both are on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: And that’s my wife, Erica. She is the last. She’s the last woman I’ve ever taken on vacation, the last woman I ever took out to dinner, the last woman I ever had sex with and, by the way, like a lot of married couples, we don’t have sex -- correction, we don’t fuck. Oh, we have intercourse less than eight. times a year, but wé never fuck.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 4.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Erica are in bed. Richard makes a move to tou her.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Honey, I don’t want to do anything. I’ve got a headache.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day in bed.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Please don’t touch me. My hair hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another day in bed.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! INT. RICHARD AND ERICA’S HOUSE - FLASHBACK

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I went though the same thing every married man does: I married my wife, she had kids and went nuts.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I want another baby.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? You’re having a baby.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I’m ready for another one.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But we worked it out. We went to couples therapy and I got my ass kicked by both of them. eee * Oe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e ee eK  02.15.06 - ITILMW 5. INT. THERAPIST’S OFFICE - FLASHBACK A pregnant Erica is crying as the therapist writes on a p and gives Richard (who we don’t see) disapproving looks.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: He doesn’t listen to me. It’s like I’m not even there. We're two strangers living in a house. ANGLE ON: Richard with bandages on his face, a black eye a fat lip.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Most men would go out and cheat. But here’s what happened when she thought I was cheating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The house is dark. Richard makes his way to the stairs quietly. Suddenly we hear a punch land, Richard falls.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey! What’s going on?

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Mutherfucker,. you didn’t think I was going to find out?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Ow! My eye! You’ve got it all wrong, baby!

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Tell that to your bitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Erica is adjusting Richard’s tie. She gives Richard a kis

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But now everything's okay... it’s just that I’m bored out of my mind.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee Oe oe ee  02.15.06 - ITILMW 6. Richard turns to go, but Erica pulls him back by the tie.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I love you, too. Oh, after work * pick up two boxes of pampers. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard sits among OTHER PASSENGERS on his daily commute work. He opens his briefcase, pulls out a newspaper and a iPod. He puts the headphones on and presses a button. He plays some Wu Tang Clan and starts reading the New York Times. Richard looks around at the WOMEN in his car.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: So our marriage was normal, which * meant I wasn’t getting laid. * A pretty girl stands holding a pole. To Richard it appear to be more seductive than it is.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now what I don’t understand is, how can my wife not have sex with me and then send me out into a world with so many beautiful women? I’ve * always liked looking at women, but now I stare at them like a damn psycho. I have to do everything I * can to resist them. * The camera PANS to another BEAUTIFUL BLACK WOMAN putting her lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Oh yes, look at her. Put on that lipstick, baby. Oh yes, put it on. ANGLE ON: a BLONDE WOMAN on her cell-phone.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Look at her on the phone. Yes, dial those numbers. Let me see you talk. Yeah, say something dirty. What’s wrong with me? ANGLE ON: a SPANISH WOMAN reading the paper.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 7.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: What about her? Turn that page. Yes, that’s nice. Read baby. Yeah, read for daddy. That’s it. Maybe I should just drive to work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morning COMMUTERS bustle through the streets on their to work.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I don’t really like living in New Jersey. It’s so boring, but that’s what Erica wants. You know how that goes. I LOVE Manhattan. I love the flow of the crowd. I love the mix of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard in midtown. He is moving in the throng.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I love that-- oh shit! We see SIX BLACK AND PUERTO RICAN THUGS walking down the street toward Richard.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Let me get my ass across the street. Richard crosses the street. The thugs pass by. All is wel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard walks through the busy lobby toward the elevator. stands waiting for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: I work as an investment banker at a place called “The Gotham Asset Company.” I‘m one of the only blacks at the firm. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD (V.O.) (cont'd) As a matter of fact, there are so few here that I think I know every black person in the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is walking the hallway. He sees the cleaning lady mopping the floor.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How’s it going, Pam?

dialogues.speaker: PAM
dialogues.text: What’s up, Richard?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard walks into the men’s bathroom and sees the janito emptying the garbage.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What’s up, Ron?

dialogues.speaker: RON
dialogues.text: Good morning, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard buys a Kit Kat at the newsstand. The elevator com and Richard boards.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It’s not that bad. Everybody here treats me pretty good, but I have to admit, being one of the only blacks here makes me a little paranoid, but I guess I’m okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard enters the open multi-cubicle area of this financ office and walks through the EMPTY bullpen. He stops at h mail slot. He glances through some mail. He puts his raincoat and briefcase down and starts using a computer.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 9. As he types, he unwraps the Kit-Kat bar, cracks off half it, leaving the other half on the desk. Just then ONE of SECRETARIES, TRACY, arrives. TRACY is a 26 YEAR OLD, PRET DARK-HAIRED WHITE WOMAN. She’s dressed very professionall It’s all business between these two.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: Morning, am I late?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, I’m early. I'11 get off this in a second. She hangs up her coat. Richard goes over to the printer a removes the printout, reading it. He then goes into HIS OFFICE, which is private. INT. RICHARD’S PRIVATE OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER A nicely appointed office. .A DEGREE or TWO hang on the w FAMILY PHOTOS, ETC. Not a huge office but it has a great view. of midtown. Richard does some quiet work. He is rea concentrating. e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A series of quiet (no music), extreme close ups showing: RICHARD’S PEN as he writes on a report. RICHARD’S EYES as he reads a flow chart (wearing glasses? RICHARD’S FINGER as he traces a line down a very dense sh of stock figures. We see he wears a gold class ring. He traces down the stock codes next to their current value u he settles on a single figure and taps it once.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (whispering) There you are. Richard highlights the figure and rips the sheet out, goi back out his office door. INT. OFFICE —- CONTINUOUS Richard opens the door onto a now BUSY office. Everyone i arriving at work.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (handing Tracy the print- out) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHARD (cont'd) Tracy, this is what we’re doing today. Where’s George? GEORGE, Richard’s colleague, a well dressed bespectacled WHITE MAN, and MARY, the other receptionist who is exactl like Tracy but HISPANIC, walk up the bullpen aisle, talki loudly until they reach George’s private office which is to Richard's.

dialogues.speaker: MARY
dialogues.text: Why is there always a track-fire? Every morning I’m sitting on a train waiting for a track fire.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: c'mon, Mary. They tell you it’s a track fire because they don’t want to say rat stampede.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: George, your wife is on the phone and Veronica called.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Okay, call back Veronica and tell my wife I'll call her later. (to Richard) Rich, you want to go over that stuff before Landis gets in? Just then, MR. LANDIS, the boss walks in. Landis is a 55 YEAR OLD WHITE MAN, a Gene Hackman type.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDIS
dialogues.text: Too late. I’m here. ‘Morning everyone. Cooper, can you bring those contracts to my office ASAP?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No problem. I’11l get them right now.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDIS
dialogues.text: Tracy, send somebody to Starbucks.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: It’s already done.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDIS
dialogues.text: Alright. Let’s get to work, people. cur TO:  02.15.06 - ITILMW 11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George pops his head in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Lunch? Richard gives him a look like “you ask this everyday and know the answer.”

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Had to ask. Who knows, you might just say “yes” one day. EXT. MIDTOWN — DAY We see PEOPLE in line at a chicken/pita stand, a line goi outside of a McDonald’s anda long line at the Soup Nazi stand on West 55th street. Mary and Tracy sit on a bench Bryant Park, eating salads, chatting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reception area is empty.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. RICHARD’S OFFICE - SAME Richard is at his desk pouring over papers hard at work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the SOUP NAZI closing his. place. We see the chicken/pita stand closing down. We see a HOT DOG MAN pouring dirty hot dog water into the street.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 12.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They say New York is the city that never sleeps, and it’s true, but what they don’t say is that every day around three PM, after lunch New York takes a little nap and that’s when I like to get out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BARNEY'S - MEN’S DEPARTMENT - LATER Richard is in the MEN’S DEPARTMENT of the store looking a shirts. A SALESMAN approaches him. MUSIC: Department store muzak.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you find something?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, I’m just looking. He looks further. An average looking SALESWOMAN approache him.

dialogues.speaker: SALESWOMAN
dialogues.text: Have you seen the new Prada suits?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No thanks. I’m just looking. A GAY SALESMAN approaches, not over the top but still gay comes over with cologne.

dialogues.speaker: GAY SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Excuse me, sir, would you like to try the new fragrance from Calvin Klein?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, that’s okay. He follows Richard and sprays a little in the air.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 13.

dialogues.speaker: GAY SALESMAN
dialogues.text: You should really try it. . It’s fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey, man, don’t spray that shit on me!

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BARNEY’S - MEN’S SHOE DEPARTMENT -— CONTINUOUS Richard is now looking at some shoes. Another SALESMAN approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: SALESMAN
dialogues.text: Can I help you with anything?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, just looking. A beautiful ASIAN SALESGIRL approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: Can I help you? MUSIC STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (referring to a shirt) Yeah, do you have this in blue? She picks up a green shirt and holds it up to his body.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: You should try this green one.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don’t like green.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: No, you should. Go try it on. Richard shrugs. cur TO:  02.15.06 - ITILMW 14. INT. BARNEY’S MEN’S DRESSING ROOM - MOMENTS LATER We see Richard in the dressing room, buttoning up his shi The salesgirl walks in before he’s got it buttoned up and now sharing the tight space with him.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: That looks great on you.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Really? You think so?

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: It’s sexy. I like it. Richard looks again.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t normally wear stuff like this.

dialogues.speaker: SALESGIRL
dialogues.text: You should start. You look really handsome in it. Hey, Lisa... The Asian salesgirl draws back the curtain. A beautiful BLACK SALESGIRL, LISA, joins them in the dressing room wh is now even more cramped. Lisa looks him up and down. Bot girls are standing very close to him and staring at him i the mirror.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (looking in the mirror) You think so?

dialogues.speaker: BOTH SALESGIRLS
dialogues.text: Yes, very handsome. Just then the gay salesman that was trying to sell the cologne sticks his head in the dressing room.

dialogues.speaker: GAY SALESMAN
dialogues.text: I think it looks great on you.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, I'll take the shirt! cur TO:  02.15.06 - ITILMW 15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the CROWD OF COMMUTERS hurries to catch their trains home to the suburbs. PEOPLE on line at a bus stop.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KELLY’S BEDROOM - SAME Kelly’s nursery is decorated in a HELLO KITTY motif. Eric is putting Kelly in her crib. She HEARS the front door op and close.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Daddy’s home. Richard enters the room. Looks into the crib. Kisses Eric She smiles putting down his. stuff.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How’s it going?

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Watch this. How big is Kelly? Kelly raises her arms over her head.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: This big.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey, big girl!

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Where’s Kelly’s nose? Kelly points at her own nose.

dialogues.speaker: KELLY
dialogues.text: Right here.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Alright! Now where is Kelly's esophagus? Where’s Kelly’s Patella? Where’s your femur?

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: (chuckling) Give her a break. She’s only two.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 16.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So what? There’re white kids her age taking the bar exam. She's gotta keep up. Richard pulls his turtleneck off, but stops when it is covering his face. He peeks out of the neck at Kelly.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey, Kelly! Look out! Turtle- man’s gonna getcha! Turtle Man’s gonna getcha! Kelly laughs. Erica laughs. Erica sees his SHOPPING BAGS.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: You went shopping? What did you buy? He takes the shirt out of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I thought you didn’t like green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard enters wearing the green sweater. He starts towar the door to his office.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: There’s a woman in there waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: A woman? Who? He enters his office. INT. RICHARD’S OFFICE - MOMENTS LATER A very BEAUTIFUL BLACK WOMAN has her back turned to us. She’s smoking a cigarette and WEARING super-tight low rid SEVEN jeans over her perfect-stop-traffic ass, a red PRAD top over stop-air-traffic tits and MANOLO BLAHNIK shoes o her perfect feet. She turns around in SLOW MOTION and we meet NIKKI.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 17.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I knew you wouldn’t recognize me.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Nikki?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: What? Did you think I was dead? Richard puts his stuff down, settling into his office and tries to act like he’s not affected by her.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I wasn’t really thinking about you. She takes a slow drag off her cigarette, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You know, people don’t smoke in offices anymore. He goes over and opens a window.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You don’t seem happy to see me.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, hey. I’m happy to see you. He gives her a quick, uncomfortable hug, then moves away.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So, what brings you here?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I came to see you. I just bumped into Simon at Starbucks and he told me you worked here, so I figured I’d come up and say hi.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: How’s Simon doing? He owes me a call?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: He’s alright. Just got out-of rehab. (then impressed) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ee F  02.15.06 - ITILMW 18. NIKKI (cont'd) Look at you. You’re a big man * here?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Not really. I have a few people I have to answer to, but I’m not complaining. They take good care of me. Richard takes his daily Kit-Kat out of his pocket, cracks half and starts eating it, leaving the rest on his desk a leans back in his chair. Nikki sees pictures of Richard's family on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Are you married?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes, for seven years. That’s my daughter, Kelly, she’s two and that’s my wife, Erica. We have another baby on the way.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Really? You? You got married? * You walked down the aisle? You * said "I do”? Are you happily * married? * He looks at her for beat.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Uhh yeah... I’m happily married.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Really, I don’t know. You didn’t say it right.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Really? How should I have said it?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I know you shouldn’t have had to think about it. I hear ice cracking.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: When I was in Boston College I used * to walk across the Charles River to * get to school. * (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKKI (cont'd) You ever walk across a frozen river * and hear ice cracking? That’s the * scariest sound in the world.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, my ice is fine. You married?

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Me married? Hell no! Phone RINGS. Richard answers it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: (to Nikki) Excuse me. (into phone) Hello?... Yeah, come right now. I’m not doing anything. He hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Am I in the way?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, you're okay. So what are you doing with yourself? Nikki sits on his desk, picking up the other half of the Kat and eats it.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Nothing great. I work at the Blue Bar. You know, right next to Nell’s.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Next to Nell’s? I don’t think I’ve been to a club in like six years.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Damn, you really did settle down. I'd like to settle down, but I still like to hang out real late. I-like to have breakfast when everybody else is eating lunch.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Ooh, what a rebel. They share an uncomfortable silence.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 20.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Hey, look, sometimes I’m free in the afternoon. If you call maybe one day we could have a late lunch.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You don’t want to have lunch with me. You’re just trying to make up for being so mean when you walked in.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, listen, it would be great to see you and catch up. The intercom BUZZES. Richard picks up his phone, now all business. Nikki sees this and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah... Okay, let’s go over that tomorrow... (to Nikki) Later, Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still wearing the green sweater, Richard sits with other PASSENGERS on his way home. He‘s got his headphones on listening to Wu Tang Clan.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Seeing Nikki made me realize how uncomfortable I’d become with women. I’d like to think that before I got married I knew how to talk to women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is walking through Times Square in SLOW MOTION. PEOPLE pass him by. He’s dressed in an Armani suit, cool shades and expensive shoes, very slick and rich looking. has an intense look on his face. The general atmosphere tells us this is not reality. MUSIC: “Excuse Me Miss” by Jay-Z plays. Through some subtle VISUAL AND SOUND EFFECT, Richard’s bo lights up for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Look at this... Luther Vandross. Patti Labell, Lévertt, Wu Tang, Tribe, P.E., Snoop, Jodeci. Ya know, white people make music too.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI

dialogues.text: I'll listen with my nigger ears. She puts back her iPod, starts leaving. On-her way out, s runs her hand through Richard's hair. playfully.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 44.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA

dialogues.text: Any black kids? INT. TRAIN —- MORNING Richard is on the train. He takes out his iPod, scrolls through some songs and clicks on the songs that Nikki put there for him. He hates the first few songs and clicks fa then he finally stops at “Closer” by Nine Inch Nails. Whi the music is playing we see that Richard is affected by w he’s hearing. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. RICHARD’S OFFICE - DAY Richard is at his file cabinet going through some files. Tracy walks in. She’s got an attitude.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Just let her in. Tracy walks out. Nikki walks in.

dialogues.text: Actually I came to ask if you'd come with me to look at a place in Harlem. I’m just a little scared to go up there alone.

dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So, I’1l see you this afternoon. Richard and Nikki leave. George watches them leave, wondering...

dialogues.text: INT. TAXI CAB — DAY Nikki and Richard are in the back of a cab.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I don’t know how you can stand working in an office. It looks so unreal to me. Everyone’s dressed the same. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NIKKI (cont'd) Everyone’s so busy working for some big company that doesn’t give a fuck about them. It’s sad.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI

dialogues.text: The building isn’t bad, but the building next to it is go Just a lot full of rubble. Richard and Nikki get out of t cab and walk into the building. Richard looks around at t FOLKS hanging around on the street. He sticks out in his nice suit. He looks uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: . GEORGE

dialogues.text: So how many cities did you live in with this Teddy guy?

dialogues.text: Here and New York. In Miami I lived with his brother, that’s how I met him. (still looking in her purse) Where the hell are my keys?

dialogues.text: You lived with a guy, then left him and moved in with his brother? How the fuck did you pull that off? I have a hard time telling my wife I want pancakes.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: Hey, I’m not saying it was easy. I really didn’t want to hurt him, but I had to follow my heart. Richard thinks about it. Then...

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: That’s what I like about you. You don’t care what anybody says. You do whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: You‘re wrong. I don’t do whatever I want. I try to do whatever I want. Big difference. (beat) Damn, he changed the locks.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 63.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s get dutta here.

dialogues.text: No, wait a minute. Let me try one more thing. Nikki walks down the hall and knocks on a door. Cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK

dialogues.text: Nikki and Richard walk in. Nikki starts going. through st while Richard looks around. The large windows look out on the POURING RAIN. He finds a photo album on a table and looks through it. We SEE old pictures of Nikki. Nikki at the prom, as a cheerleader, etc.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: It’s really coming down. (dawning on him) We gotta get a flight. What time is it? He looks at his watch. Nikki is oblivious going through h things.

dialogues.text: “Shut your fucking face, uncle fucker / You're a motherfuckin’ bitch, uncle fucker / You're an uncle fucker / Yes, it’s true / Nobody fucks uncle quite like you." A voice is HEARD off screen.

dialogues.text: Can I help you? They both turn, startled, to find TEDDY, a fat guy with d locks, dressed in a football jersey. He stands at the ope door.

dialogues.text: Teddy. I’m just-

dialogues.text: Who the fuck is this? You brought your man to my crib? So this is the nigga. Teddy walks up to Richard and Richard stick out his hand shake.

dialogues.text: No, no, I’m not the nigga. I assure you, I am not the nigga. Teddy cuts him off with a slap to the face. He drops the shirt on the floor.

dialogues.text: Don’t drop my shirt on the floor, bitch!  02.15.06 - ITILMW 65.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh shit, look, I’m sorry I didn’t know. . Teddy swings at Richard. Richard covers up. The blow hits him on the arm and head and he falls, knocking down a lam that falls and breaks.

dialogues.text: Hey, nigger, that shit’s Chinese. You.owe me four grand. Teddy starts punching and kicking at Richard who is curle a ball.

dialogues.text: Hey! Watch your mouth. They all turn around to see TWO COPS standing at the open door. .

dialogues.text: What the fuck do y’all want? cop #1 / We were responding to a burglary upstairs. Is everything okay?

dialogues.speaker: TEDDY
dialogues.text: This mother-fucker broke into my apartment, and this bitch- He pulls her by the hair. She screams.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 66. cop #2 Hey! The two cops run over and separate them. They are now restraining a furious Teddy.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Oh shit! Let’s go.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 67. INT. TAXI CAB —- MOMENTS LATER The rain is pouring down REALLY hard. on their cab, which stuck in traffic not moving.

dialogues.speaker: NIKKI
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry. I am so sorry! I thought he was out of town. Just then Nikki leans over and kisses Richard and for a couple of seconds they’re making out in the cab until Ric pushes her away.

dialogues.text: Get off of me! What the fuck is wrong with... I gotta get back to work.

RICHARD AND ERICA’S KITCHEN - LATER THAT NIGHT Erica sits at the kitchen table, looking down at her dinn Richard’s dinner sits across from her. She looks solemn, bit sad. She is waiting for a while then the door opens a Richard is there, looking haggard.

dialogues.text: What happened to you? Why are you late?  02.15.06 - ITILMW 69.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No. Just let me clean up. I’11 be right back.- Go ahead and eat. He leaves the room, taking off his coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Erica sitting down and eating and not saying anything to each other. First, we have the camera CLOSE-U on Erica just eating. Then we have the camera CLOSE-UP on Richard eating and thinking. Then we see Richard look at T.V. where we see the news-- ee

dialogues.speaker: NEWSCASTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today in Washington, D.C., a man named Teddy Smith shot and wounded two police officers. He was later apprehended after a violent stand- off. Richard stops eating.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: (off his reaction) Are you sure you’re okay?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m fine. I’m great. Just tired. Can I get some more rice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard on his way to work. He’s listening to his iPod. H looks tired and slightly disheveled. INT. RICHARD’S OFFICE - THE NEXT DAY  02.15.06 - ITILMW 70. Richard walks into his office, taking off his coat. He reaches in the pocket and is startled to find the boardin pass from the night before. He holds it in his hand, considering what if it’d been found. He sits at his desk, ripping it to pieces and lets out a breath of relief. Jus then Mr. Landis walks in.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDIS
dialogues.text: Okay, Cooper, what happened to you yesterday? You look like shit.

dialogues.text: I can explain. I was...

dialogues.text: Did your mother die?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD

dialogues.text: Did your father die?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Ah, no.

dialogues.speaker: MR. LANDIS

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.text: And I can see that you’re breathing which means you have no fucking excuse, Cooper! You’re on probation. If you mess up one more time you’re fired. You fuck up my money, I’ll fuck up yours. AmTI understood?!

dialogues.text: Need a ride?  02.15.06 - ITILMW 71.

dialogues.text: Yeah, could you just drop me off at the train station?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Come on, I'll drop you.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD

dialogues.text: Hey, you don’t have to explain shit to me. I said my piece just don’t let it fuck with your work again. You know, when you mess up like that the whole office starts looking at me like, “where’s your friend?” You wouldn’t believe some of the racist shit they say when you're not around.

dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You don’t want to know. I just hope she’s worth it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.text: You know what I’m talking about. Hey, I got something for you. George reaches into the glove compartment and hands Richa blue pill.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: What's this?  02.15.06 - ITILMW 72.

dialogues.text: What do you think it is? It’s Viagra.

dialogues.text: You just keep Viagra in the glove compartment?

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Right next to the Altoids.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I don’t need it.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Rich, you’ve been married seven years. These girls have changed since you were single. They're working out, they’re watching porn, they’re doing yoga. It’s like they got “rodeo pussy” and if you don‘t have enough dick you’re gonna get tossed off.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: For the last time, I’m not fucking her.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: Well, if you don’t fuck her you‘re gonna fuck somebody. I can see it in your eyes. You're gone, man... Okay, what’s going on with you and your wife?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Nothing we’re fine. Alright! We're doing just fine.

dialogues.speaker: GEORGE
dialogues.text: You're not fine. If you were doing just fine you wouldn’t be fucking it up. Listen, I know I gave you that pill for Nikki, but if you really want to be happy use it on Erica. George laughs at Richard who doesn’t want to hear it. Ric leaves the car and George pulls away.

dialogues.text: Richard and Erica are driving home from the supermarket w Kelly. MUSIC: “Chop Suey!” By System of a Down plays in the background.

dialogues.text: Honey, what’s wrong?

dialogues.text: Nothing. I’m fine. What are you talking. about?

dialogues.text: No, I don’t. I got in the car the other day and all my CDs are gone. What happened to my Usher? My Beyonce? ee ee HK  02.15.06 - ITILMW 74.

dialogues.text: Boy, did I fuck up. My job had me on probation. My wife was becoming suspicious. And on top of that, being one of the only black people in the office was starting to get to me.

(beat) ’ So are you still mad at me? You won't take my calls. Are we okay? INT. DEPARTMENT STORE - WOMEN’S DEPARTMENT - SAME Richard and Nikki. are now walking around the women’s department.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So, my boss is mad at me. My wife is mad at me. But it’s okay, I’11 live.

dialogues.text: What's so sad about that? At least I’m in something. I got a family. You‘re the sad one. Who do you have?

dialogues.text: No, I’m not but you want my opinion of the guy, you must like hima little bit.

dialogues.text: What the hell is wrong with me?! How could I yell at Erica like that? I’m losing my mind. I gotta go home. Next stop I’m gonna get off this train and go home to my wife. That’s what I’m gonna do. I’m going home. cur TO:

dialogues.text: You scared me. What are you doing home so early? Everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: We're are the kids?  02.15.06 - ITILMW 103.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I just dropped them off at my mother’s house.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Everything’s fine. I was just missing you and thought I’d come home early.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Are you sure that’s it? For once could you be honest and tell me what’s really wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: MUSIC STARTS
dialogues.text: Richard and Erica start to talk/sing at each other, but n “sing sing” more of a talk-sing like the beginning of a B White or Rick James and Teena Marie record. Romantic musi plays throughout the end of this scene.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: You know, baby, I.just wanna tell you how sorry I am for being so cold. It’s not that I don’t like being married. It’s just that sometimes it feels like the walls are closing in on me.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I understand, baby. But it’s not just you. I gotta admit that I’ve been distant too. I haven’t always been nice. As a matter of fact, sometimes I’m as cold as ice.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: So cold. So cold. You’ve been very cold, baby.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: But one thing I have to ask you, baby... it’s time I know the score, but the thing I have to ask you is how come you don’t make love to me anymore?

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD \
dialogues.text: It’s been a long time.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: A mighty, mighty long time.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 104.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Baby, I still want you and I’ve wanted you for so long. But every time I touch you, you act like I_ did something wrong.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: No, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes, you do.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: No, I don’t.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Yes, it’s true... I don’t want to leave.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: Neither do I.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I still want you.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I’m gonna cry.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Where are the kids?

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I told you. They’re gone.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: In that case, we should make love.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD AND ERICA
dialogues.text: All night long. Yeah. Big swell in the music and then it stops.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: I love you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: ERICA
dialogues.text: I love you, too.  02.15.06 - ITILMW 105. At that moment, Erica and Richard start kissing passionat and taking each other’s clothes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Richard come out of the master bedroom just: like the beginning of the movie. We see him put on his coat an walk over to Erica and give her a big kiss goodbye. V.0O. starts as Richard leaves the house. Al Green's, “Let Get Married” is playing.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: A lot of people have rules about what's cheating and what’s not. Some people say if you’re in another country it’s not cheating. Some people say if you’re in another room it’s not cheating. I used to think I was a good father and a bad husband, but now I that I’m older I realize that if you’re cheating on your wife, you’re cheating on your kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Nikki sitting in first class gazing out the window , with her iPod on.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I’m really going to miss Nikki and the bad thing is I can’t tell anybody about it. I gotta keep this whole thing to myself. cur TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard is sitting down, puts his iPod on and is looking the window as the train moves.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Any guy I’d tell would think I was erazy for not having sex with her. And any woman I tell would think I was a dog for letting it get that far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Nikki at the auto show. Cur TO: INT. RICHARD’'S OFFICE Nikki walking into Richard’s office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard and Erica sitting at one of the same restaurants was at with Nikki.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard on the train.

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: It just wasn’t the right time. You know when all is said and done, I think I love my wife. We see Richard start nodding his head to whatever music i playing on his iPod. A BEAUTIFUL BLACK GIRL walks by him. Richard takes a look and shakes his head in disbelief.
